Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the baby survived heart surgery and then contracted COVID-19, without providing enough evidence to support this assertion.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides Facebook posts and captions as evidence, without any medical records or official sources to verify the information.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the baby in the picture is named Kyle and that he has COVID-19, without confirming these details from reliable sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the baby in the picture is actually named Cameron and his mother has confirmed that he does not have COVID-19.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the misleading posts are using an old picture of Cameron Bartle, who had heart surgery in the past, to falsely claim that he has COVID-19.
